description: You will love these pan-fried Cajun chickpea fries made from chickpea flour. They are golden crispy brown on the outside and creamy, tender and delicious on the inside. Serve with my vegan cilantro lime dip for a fun glutenfree appetizer or party snack. Vegan Glutenfree Soyfree Recipe
keywords: chickpea flour fries, chickpea flour recipes, vegan cilantro lime dip
name: Cajun Chickpea Fries with Cilantro Jalapeno Lime Cream Dip

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the Chickpea Flour, water, salt, and garlic powder until smooth. Then add to a sauce pan over medium heat and cook. The mixture will get lumpy, stir occasionally and it will eventually and even out to a thicker custard like state. Continue to cook for another 2 mins after it has thickened evenly. Transfer the mixture to a greased 7-8 inch pan or spread over parchment and even out on the top using parchment paper.
Chill for 20 minutes, and slice the chickpea into fry size slices.
Add the chickpea fries to a skillet over medium heat with 2 tsp of oil and panfry until most of the edges are golden.
Take off heat and add in the cajun spice, garlic, salt (only if your Cajun blend doesnâ€™t have salt), in pan, and toss well to coat. Taste and ajust to salt and spice.
